footer: Â© 2022 my-PV GmbH, Austria.<br>All Rights reserved.<br><a href='http://www.my-pv.com'>www.my-pv.com</a>
chart_text: For the the graphical representation of the operating data, live.my-pv.com must be used - see:
acthor_error1: Error 101: No phase on relay center contact detected
acthor_error2: Error 102: Temperature sensor 1 required for hotwater boost. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error3: Error 103: Temperature sensor 1 required for this mode. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error4: Error 104: Temperature sensor 1 required for spaceheating. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error5: Error 105: Temperature sensor 1 required for hotwater. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error6: Error 106: Controllable power < Load at relay
acthor_error7: Error 107: Temperature sensor 2 required for spaceheating. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error8: Error 108: Temperature sensor 2 required for PWM. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error9: Error 109: Temperature sensor 1 required for legionella protection. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error10: Error 110: FW Update failed. Communication-Error with power stage. Restart device
acthor_error11: Error 111: FW Update failed. Problem with p-File. Switch off device. Insert SD card with p-File. See manual my-pv.com Restart device
acthor_error12: Error 112: Temperature sensor 3 required for hotwater boost. Check if the sensor has been activated!
acthor_error13: Error 113: Power stage communication timeout. Restart device
acthor_error14: Error 114: Power stage in boot mode. Restart device
acthor_error15: Error 115: Temperature sensors 2+3 required for spaceheating. Check if sensors have been activated!
acthor_error17: Error 117: Powerstage overtemperature. Device restarts after cool down.
acthor_error18: Error 118: No load detected. Check STB.
acthor_error19: Error 119: Operating pressure <1.2 bar - Increase operating pressure.
elwa2_ctrl_error_1: Power stage communication timeout. Please contact support@my-pv.com and give us the serial number.
elwa2_ctrl_error_2: External temperature sensor T2 required for this operating mode.
elwa2_ctrl_error_4: Plug connection of heating rod not engaged. Check the correct connection of the six-pin plug.
elwa2_ctrl_error_8: Co-controller: no valid ec-firmware found - please download ec-firmware
elwa2_ctrl_error_10: Power stage: no valid ep-firmware found - please download ep-firmware
elwa2_ctrl_error_20: No phase detected on AUX relay centre contact.
elwa2_ctrl_error_40: External temperature sensor T2 required for boost backup via SELV relay.
elwa2_ctrl_error_80: Phase (L) and neutral conductor (N) on the electrical connection are reversed. Check the terminal points!
elwa2_warning_1: letsencypt root certificates are invalid, show error on screen when device has network connection
solthor_ctrl_error_1: Communication timeout in the power unit. Please contact support@my-pv.com and tell us the serial number.
solthor_ctrl_error_2: AC power supply required for back-up or legionella boost.
solthor_ctrl_error_8: Co-controller: no valid sc-firmware found. Please download sc-firmware.
solthor_ctrl_error_10: Power unit: no valid sp-firmware found. Please download sp-firmware.
solthor_ctrl_error_40: External temperature sensor T1 required for back-up via BOOST relay.
solthor_ctrl_error_80: External temperature sensor T2 required for back-up via BOOST relay.
solthor_warning_1: PS-Update can't be done because of low PV-Power / missing AC
solthor_warning_2: letsencypt root certificates are invalid, show error on screen when device has network connection
chart_m3_warning: If no my-PV Meter is used for power measurement at the switched load, the power display of the ACâ€¢THOR and the energy recording of the data logger cannot take this consumption into account!
relaymode0_txt: ðŸ›ˆ If no my-PV Meter is used for power measurement at the switched load, the power display of the ACâ€¢THOR and the energy recording of the data logger cannot take this consumption into account!
relayload1: Load measurement on relays with my-PV Meter
relaymode1_txt: ðŸ›ˆ For the my-PV Power Meter, the ID (serial number) has 7 digits.<br>For the my-PV WiFi Meter, the ID (serial number) has 10 digits.
wws_tmax_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Only relevant if sensor activated.
rh_temp: Temperature max / min day / min night
relay_mde: ACâ€¢THOR regulates when relay is on
relay_mde_elwa2: AC ELWA 2 regulates when relay is on
ctrltype_api: ðŸ›ˆ To be able to use the 'my-PV API' control type, you must create an API access token in the cloud.
ctrltype_tip: For many control types there are separate instructions for the required settings.<br>More information can be found <a href="https://www.my-pv.com/en/info/compatible-manufacturers" target="_blank">here</a>.
ctrltype102: Kostal PIKO IQ Plenticore plus Manual
ctrltype204: IME Conto D4 Modbus MID (Modbus RTU)
control_mreg_sep_feedin: Separate meter register for feed-in<br>(0 if not present)
control_ptarget_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Negative value means feed-in. Only change this value if you are familiar with the control strategy - read Help for more details.
control_ptarget2: Interval target value of the control:
control_ptarget2_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Interval target value: If active, a different target value of the control is used in the set time window.
control_pt2_t1: Duration of the interval target value:
measure_help: ðŸ›ˆ Excess power in the grid feed-in point is already detected by the device configured for control (see Control Settings). In addition, these measured variables can optionally be detected for display in the live.my-pv.com cloud. They have no relevance for the operation of the my-PV device.
measure_meterid_info: ðŸ›ˆ For the my-PV Power Meter, the ID (serial number) has 7 digits.<br>For the my-PV WiFi Meter, the ID (serial number) has 10 digits.
meas3_pt2_t2: Additional duration of the interval target value when power is drawn (> 500W) from the charging station.
meas3_ptarget2_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Only relevant in connection with the interval target value under "Control Settings".
multiunits_smatxt: The Control Type setting 'SMA Home Manager' does not support multi-unit-mode, but you can control multiple my-PV devices directly using the SMA Home Manager.
multiunits_state1: Warning: More than one device with this ID in the system
ipset_elwa2_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Notice: Changes to the IP settings lead to a reboot of the device.
ipset_dhcpmode_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Use static IP only if you are familiar with network administration.
basset_meter_ct_other_info: ðŸ›ˆ Maximal secondary winding current must not exceed 125mA.
cloudmode_privacy: By activating, I agree that in addition to settings data, operational data will also be regularly transmitted to the online platform live.my-pv.com. This data is treated strictly confidentially and will not be shared with third parties. my-PV uses it exclusively for internal purposes such as data analysis, research, or product improvement. More information: my-pv.com/de/datenschutz
debugmode_txt: ðŸ›ˆ Enable debug mode only after consulting my-PV.
fwvers_updateerror: Last Firmware-Update was canceled because of a connection error!
message_browser_nsupp: Your browser does not support this feature.
confirm_psfwupdate: Download and install power stage firmware?
confirm_p9sfwupdate: Download and install s-power stage firmware?
newpwd: New password(min 8 characters, upper/lower case letters/number/special characters)
likenews: I want to receive the my-PV newsletter
name: Name
if_this_device_is_in_another_location_fi: The device is currently being added to the <b>{0}</b> system. Create a new system first if the new device is in a different location.
local-csv-download-is-currently-not-supp: Local CSV download is currently not supported.
chart_nocurrentdata_desc: No data is available in this overview because the device is either offline or cloud mode has not yet been activated in the settings.
infos_nocurrentdata_desc: Due to missing data no information in this overview is available.
chart_nodevices_desc: No devices have been added to this system yet. <br><br><a class="btn btn-primary mt-2" href="#" onclick="showAddDeviceModal();">Add a device</a>
pvsettingdesc: For correct scaling of the gauge, enter the nominal power of the photovoltaic system in Wp.
heatpumpsettingdesc: For correct scaling of the gauge, enter the nominal electric power of the heatpump in W.
reg-password-feedback: Your password must be at least 8 characters long, contain a special character, a number, a lowercase letter and an uppercase letter.
welcome-message-cloud-2-0: Here you can try out the my-PV Cloud: <a href='?demo=1&lang=en'>Demo-Link</a>
cloud-maintenance-in-progress: At the moment we are performing maintenance work on our server. We are trying to complete this as soon as possible and thank you for your understanding.
cloud-maintenance-resolved: Due to maintenance work there was a data gap of several hours in the log data. We apologise for any inconvenience and thank you for your understanding!
invalidInputDevNew: The serial number and device key should be exactly 16 characters long. Before adding the device, make sure you have entered the correct data. Pay attention to possible whitespaces.
csv_download_success: The CSV file should be downloaded to your device now.
csv_download_failed: The download of the CSV file failed.
loading_csv: Loading data... Depending on the range, resolution and your connection speed, this might take multiple minutes.
unknown_symbol: Unexpected symbol '{0}'. Note that you can only use '-', ':', '.', '/' or ' ' as seperator.
tempWidgetSettingsDesc: Here you can change the units for the temperature display. It is important to note that this setting is not widget-specific, but applies to all temperature displays on the dashboard view.
increase_search_limit_desc: Increase maximum results: Increases the maximum results to 2000
email_not_confirmed: Please confirm your new e-mail address in the confirmation e-mail we have sent you.
scanDeviceKeyWithQR: Scan Device Key from QR Code
incorrect_setup_meas_ctrl: This my-PV Meter is also stored as a control type in the control settings. Simultaneous setup as an (optional) measured value source is an incorrect setting! See operating instructions, chapter 'Measured value settings'.
delete_account_info_1: The deletion of your account is final and can not be reversed.
delete_account_info_2: You will no longer be able to access the charts within the cloud until you sign up again.
delete_account_info_3: Deleting your account does NOT delete any chart data as charts are device-bound and not user-bound
delete_account_info_4: The cloud mode will NOT be turned off for your devices automatically.
delete_account_info_5: The my-PV Support will be unable to restore your account, so be careful.
deleteAccountConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete your account?
delete_account_reenter_your_email: Re-enter your email to confirm account deletion
sys_details_saved: The system details have been saved.
settings-cloudctrl-info-cloudctrl-allows: API access to your device by using an API token.
settings-cloudctrl-delete-the-token-to-c: Token was already created. Delete the token first to create a new one.
settings-cloudctrl-only-the-owner-of-the: Only the owner of the device can modify API access.
settings-cloudctrl-currently-disabled-ge: API access is currently disabled. Generate a new API token to enable it.
settings-cloudctrl-make-sure-to-copy-you: Make sure to copy your new custom API token now. You won't be able to see it again.
settings-cloudctrl-token-can-only-be-gen: API Token can only be generated by owner.
settings-cloudctrl-cloudmode-is-required: Cloud mode is activated when the API token is generated.
settings-cloudctrl-warning-with-this-cod: Warning: Your device can be remotely controlled with this API access token. Keep it secure.
settings-cloudctrl-more-info: Technical details can be found in the API documentation:
settings-cloudctrl-do-you-really-want-to: Do you really want to delete the API access token? The connection to your remote controls will be lost.
settings-cloudctrl-is-only-available-in-: APi access is only available in the my-PV live cloud.
settings-cloudctrl-wait-10-minutes-befor: The API access token can be used with the device approx. 10 minutes after it has been generated.
measure_adjustable_modbus_tcp_warning: A very simple way to record these measured variables is to use a <a href="https://www.my-pv.com/de/produkte/my-pv-wifi-meter/" target="_blank">my-PV Meter</a>.  All you need to do is enter the serial number.  <br> Nevertheless, it is not absolutely necessary to purchase a my-PV Meter. For very tech-savvy customers, we have therefore created the option of parameterising these measuring points manually.  This is a free additional option for all those who are technically capable of doing so! As this is a data query for third-party products, we are unfortunately unable to support you in this case. If you have any questions about the required settings for third-party products, please contact the technical support of the respective company.
specialwidget_waiting_for_curdata_title: Connection to device is being established
specialwidget_waiting_for_curdata_msg: It's about to continue full of energy ...
ctrl-type-frequency-does-not-support-mul: The Control Type setting 'Frequency' does not support multi-unit-mode.
install_pwa_explanation: You can now install the my-PV Cloud app on your home screen, making it as easy as a single press to access my-PV Cloud!
install_pwa_explanation_safari: You can now install the my-PV Cloud app on your home screen, making it as easy as a single press to access my-PV Cloud!<br/><br/>To do that, you just have to press the <img src="./assets/img/safari_share.png" width="20" height="20"/> button and then "Add to Home Screen" and you are done!
adddevice-importfromolddevice-lbl: I want to import data from my old device.
adddevice-importfromolddevice-checked-in: Please ensure that the device from which you want to import data is connected to your currently selected system. You will be able to select import options in the next step.
devNewImportWarning: Be careful! This can <b>NOT</b> be reversed. Once the data has been imported it can not be removed again.
importingDataImportingTo: You are importing the data as <b>{0}</b>. If there is any overlapping data, it might cause display issues in the charts.
importingDataImportDataWarning: The device you are trying to import data into already has data. If you continue, the existing data will be PERMANENTLY ERASED and can NOT be recovered. Are you sure?
validation_too_few_pv_configs: {0}: at least one orientation is required
validation_must_decimal_degree: {0}: must be a valid decimal degree
validation_invalid_country: The selected country is not supported.
validation_must_inclination: {0}: must be a valid inclination between 0Â° and 90Â°
validation_must_azimuth: {0}: must be a valid azimuth between -180Â° and 180Â°
widget_soc_dtoedit_alert: The accuracy of the State of Charge (SoC) calculation is relevant for the my-PV DTO. You get the maximum benefit when the SoC can be calculated by positioning the temperature sensors as precisely as possible. A third temperature sensor can further improve the calculation accuracy.
setup_soc_widget_desc: You need to configure this widget before you can use it.
soc_initial_configuration: The correct calculation of SOC depends on proper configuration, so please ensure you configure the widget as accurately as possible.<br><br><b>Please also be sure to follow the sequence of temperature sensors!</b> Make sure that any temperature sensors that are not inside your boiler are deactivated (just uncheck the box!).
settings-dto-cloudctrl-is-still-activate: You need to disable API control of your device before enabling the DTO.
dto_not_allowed: Only the owner of the device can modify my-PV DTO.
enableDtoSubtext: A variable electricity supply tariff is necessary for DTO.
checkboxEnableDto: Enable DTO. I have a variable tariff rate.
dtoWizEnableSubtext: A dynamic electricity tariff (consumption tariff) is required to activate the my-PV DTO.
dtoWizTopNotice: Please note: In operating mode M1, the SOLâ€¢THOR can use either AC or DC, not both. Therefore, when grid power is inexpensive, the SOLâ€¢THOR may not operate using PV energy.
dtoWizCheckboxEnableDTO: I acknowledge that this function (my-PV DTO) may become chargeable in the future. If this is the case, we will inform you in time.
dtoWizCheckboxEnableDTOError: Please note that a variable rate tariff is necessary for DTO.
dtoWizNoPvPresent: No, I do not have a PV system. Optimization based only on the electricity market price.
dtoWizPvPresent: Yes, I have a PV system with the my-PV device.
dtoWizMode1: Optimal calculation using SoC (requires at least 2 sensors in the boiler)
dtoWizMode2: Optimization based on the number of people in the household
dtoWizMode3: Heat whenever the electricity price falls below a certain value
dtoWizPriceNote: The electricity exchange prices vary depending on the country or zone.
dtoWizMaxPwrNote: Total power output of all heating elements controlled by the my-PV device.
dtoWizWwsSubtext: To ensure that there is always enough hot water, the boost mode will be enabled.
dtoWizWwsRelais: Further configuration of the relay can be made in the boost mode settings.
setup_soc_widget_not_enough_sensors: Your device does not have sufficient temperature sensors connected. You need at least two sensors to calculate the charge status of your boiler.
batblock_infobox: This setting is required if the my-PV device is operating in â€˜Price optimisation with batteryâ€™ mode. When this function is activated, the discharge of the battery is blocked when heating with price optimization in order to prevent discharging.
setup_soc_widget_acthor_in_incompatible_: SoC can not be used in main mode M5 or M6.
dto-device-not-compatible-update-firmwar: Device firmware is not compatible with my-PV DTO. First update firmware in settings.
dto_enter_your_address_and_the_gps_coord: Enter your address and the GPS coordinates will be filled in automatically.
dto_info_inclination: Inclination: <br> always in relation to the earth's surface <br> 0 (horizontal) ... 90 (vertical)
dto_info_azimuth: Azimuth: -180 ... 180 <br> (-180 = north, -90 = east, 0 = south, 90 = west, 180 = north)
dto_info_lat: Latitude of location: -90 (south) ... 90 (north)<br> Handeled with a precission of 0.0001 or abt. 10 m
dto_info_lon: Longitude of location: -180 (west) â€¦ 180 (east)<br> Handeled with a precission of 0.0001 or abt. 10 m
not_permitted: You do not have the necessary permissions to perform this operation.
dtoWizWhatIsDtoTitle: What do we mean by the my-PV Dynamic Tariff Optimizer?
dtoWizWhatIsDto: Easily benefit from dynamic prices in the electricity market and complete the heating preparation at the cheapest prices: The my-PV DTO activates the heating preparation always at the cheapest hours on the electricity exchange. If you also use a photovoltaic system, then the weather data is also taken into account for the calculation to optimize the heating preparation. </br><a href="https://www.my-pv.com/en/applications/my-PV-DTO/" target="_blank">More information can be found here</a>.
dtoWizModeSelectionWithPvInfobox: The weather forecast during transitional periods can lead to inaccurate performance predictions, which is compensated by ensuring hot water (Boost Mode).
dto_field_battery_kWh: Storage capacity of the battery storage in kWh
dtoWizBatBlockInfobox: To use this mode and prevent battery drainage, the battery lock must be configured in the settings!<br>Click <u><a style="cursor: pointer;" onclick="app.dto.wizard.fn.openBatBlockSettings();">here <i class='bx bx-link'></i></a></u> to make the setting.
dtoWizMode1Tooltip: Expert mode, requires many system details.
dtoWizMode2Tooltip: Estimated hot water demand based on the number of people in the household.
dtoWizMode3Tooltip: Easiest way of tariff optimized water heating with the my-PV DTO.
dtoWizTzTooltip: To be able to heat during the cheapest hours, the time zone must be set correctly. This can be adjusted in the system settings.
dto_field_savings_constant_tariff: Indication of the previous fixed electricity tariff (for consumption)
dtoWizSavingsConstantTariffInputTooltip: Net electricity price (excluding taxes or network charges). To calculate savings compared to a fixed reference tariff, an amount in ct/kWh must be specified.
batblock_is_activated_but_not_working: Battery discharge lock is activated but not configured correctly. This means that battery discharge is not prevented.
dto_no_valid_priceoptimization_selected: DTO error. Please reconfigure the DTO.
dto_error_calling_decisionengine_couldnt: The planned power could not be accepted.
dto_error_couldnt_get_price_for_your_loc: Energy prices could not be retrieved for your location
dto_forecast_soc_price_is_emtpy_or_not_2: Error regarding the SoC. Check the SoC settings.
dto_forecast_soc_is_nan: The SoC could not be calculated correctly, check your SoC settings
dto_forecast_household_invalid_number_of: Configuration error (invalid number of people in the household). Please check your DTO configuration.
dto_forecast_withpv_invalid_location: The selected location is invalid. Please check the location.
dtoHelpPageDetailsCalculationText: With the my-PV DTO, times for heat preparation are scheduled at the best possible times to maximize benefits from dynamic electricity prices.
dtoHelpPageCostsSoFarConstant: Previous costs (calculated using the specified constant electricity price):
dtoHelpPageCostsSoFarTooltip: Each hour in which heat generation takes place with the my-PV DTO, is multiplied by the respective electricity price and added to the set period.
dtoHelpPagePrognosticConsumption: The projected power consumption may differ from actual power consumption. If unexpected consumption occurs, the device will reheat using the Boost Mode.
pvf_what_is_pvf: With my-PV PV Forecast, you receive a PV yield forecast based on the weather data and orientation of the system.
dtoWidgetSavingsTooltip: Savings from optimized heating times compared to the specified fixed electricity price. Values are recalculated every hour.
solar_forecast_withpv_couldnt_fetch_pv_f: PV forecast could not be calculated due to missing forecast data (api).
solar_forecast_withpv_invalid_location: Calculation failed due to invalid location data.
couldnt_fetch_weather_forecast_from_open: Weather data could not be loaded.
Weather data could not be loaded.
calculate_solare_forecast_for_pv_system_: PV forecast could not be calculated.
dtoNotActivatedSubtext: With my-PV DTO, the heating times are adjusted to your dynamic electricity price.
dtoAvgPriceTooltip: Average electricity price at the optimized heating times calculated over the year.
dtoWizPriceThresholdWarningSubtext: <b>IMPORTANT NOTICE:</b> The price threshold value assumes the net electricity price! Additional costs such as VAT, network charges, etc. are NOT taken into account!
dtoWizPriceTooltip: The bidding zone can usually be found on the electricity bill.
dtoWizKeepWwsSettings: Instead, keep my current Boost Mode settings
dtoRecommendationWWSDesc: Do you want to setup the hot water boost now?</br></br>We recommend activating the hot water boost to ensure you have hot water even in the event of a DTO suspension (e.g., due to internet issues).
soc_widget_sensor_levels_not_valid_desc: The boiler SoC widget is not properly set. Please check the settings of the SoC widget.
dto_service_enough_energy_forecasted_no_: Sufficient PV energy available. DTO is not required.
dev_turn_off_warning: Are you sure you want to turn off the device?
device_error_check_the_device_display: Device Error: Check the device display for details.
legal-check-the-checkbox-to-confirm: Please tick the checkbox to continue.
batblock_firmware_not_compatible: Device firmware is not compatible for battery block. Update the device firmware first.
specialwidget-no-device-helptext: The serial number and device key can be found on the front of the installation instructions. If your device has a display, the data can also be called up in the menu under <b>Settings -> Cloud connection</b>.
dto_service_calculated_dto_heatingtimes_: Not enough PV energy available. Switch-on times have been scheduled.
dto_mode_changed_by_user: DTO was activated/changed by the user. New calculation is performed.
dto_mode_deactivated_by_user: DTO has been deactivated by the user.
dto_service_no_prices_below_threshold: No prices below the threshold available.
ruleset_validation_invalid_name: Invalid name. Name must been between 1 and 255 characters long.
ruleset_parse_error_max_fields: You can not use this many unique fields in a single ruleset (current limit is {0} fields)
ruleset_parse_error_max_duration: A ruleset can currently not request more than {0} of data
ruleset_parse_error_min_duration: A ruleset can currently not request less than {0} of data
ruleset_parse_error_curdata_duration: Live Data rulesets can not specify a duration of data to check - only the most recent data is available.
ruleset_delete_confirm: Are you sure that you want to delete this ruleset?
ruleset_parser_error_resolved: Parser error resolved, waiting for next execution...
rulesetSendEmailToTooltip: The recipient must be added to the system. You can enter multiple recipients by using semicolon as a delimiter.
spoWizPriceNote: The electricity exchange prices vary depending on the country or zone.
spoWizCheckboxEnableSPO: I acknowledge that this function (my-PV SPO) may become chargeable in the future. If this is the case, we will inform you in time.
spoNotActivatedSubtext: With my-PV SPO, heating times are optimized based on the feed-in tariff.
spoWizWhatIsSpoTitle: What do we mean by the SPO?
spoWizMode1: Easy Mode:<br>Quick setup, locks the my-PV device until the first hour with a negative market electricity price.
spoWizMode2: State of Charge:<br>Expert mode: The state of charge is calculated using two sensors to optimize heat generation.
spoWizMode3: People-Household:<br>The hot water demand based on the specified number of occupants is factored into the calculation.
widget_soc_spoedit_alert: The accuracy of the State of Charge (SoC) calculation is relevant for the my-PV SPO. You get the maximum benefit when the SoC can be calculated by positioning the temperature sensors as precisely as possible. A third temperature sensor can further improve the calculation accuracy.
spoHelpPageDetailsCalculationText: With the my-PV SPO, the timing of heat generation is specifically adjusted to electricity tariffs in order to minimize grid load and maximize feed-in compensation.
spoHelpPagePrognosticConsumption: The projected power consumption may differ from actual power consumption.
spo_no_valid_priceoptimization_selected: SPO error. Please reconfigure the SPO.
spo_error_calling_decisionengine_couldnt: The planned power could not be accepted.
spo_error_couldnt_get_price_for_your_loc: Energy prices could not be retrieved for your location
spo_forecast_soc_price_is_emtpy_or_not_2: Error regarding the SoC. Check the SoC settings.
spo_forecast_soc_is_nan: The SoC could not be calculated correctly, check your SoC settings
spo_forecast_household_invalid_number_of: Configuration error (invalid number of people in the household). Please check your SPO configuration.
spo_forecast_withpv_invalid_location: The selected location is invalid. Please check the location.
ruleset_add_description: You are adding a new ruleset to <b>{0}</b> in <b>{1}</b>
ruleset_edit_description: You are editing a ruleset added to <b>{0}</b> in <b>{1}</b>
rulesetsModalDescription: Define rulesets to receive notifications when certain thresholds are met.
rulesetActionsDefaultBody: Hi! This is the sample body for the e-mail. This will be sent to the specified recipients when the ruleset is triggered.
spo-device-not-compatible-update-firmwar: Device firmware is not compatible with my-PV SPO. First update firmware first in settings.
actions_invalid: To send an email notification, the system must first be shared with the email address.
remove_shared_user_confirm: Are you sure you want to remove {email} as a shared user?
delete_device_confirm: Are you sure you want to remove the device <b>{device}</b> from the system?
sessions_info: Here you can view your signed in sessions and revoke them if needed.
spoWidgetBlocking: Optimizing self-consumption â€“ Heating allowed from <X> onwards
spoWidgetNotBlocking: No negative market prices â€“ Device runs with power surplus
spoOptimizingNotCalculated: Optimization of self-consumption has not been planned yet
whoIsYourInstallerDescription: To help our <b>technical support</b> assist you in the best possible way, we kindly ask you for <b>a few brief details</b>. This way, if we have follow-up questions, we can help even faster and more precisely.
whoIsYourInstallerElectricianInput: Which electrician installed your my-PV device?
whoIsYourInstallerInstallerInput: Which installer installed your my-PV device?
whoIsYourInstallerSellerInput: Which merchant sold you your my-PV device?
csv_no_fields_selected: Downloading all fields since no fields have been selected
who_is_your_installer_questions_not_answ: Please provide at least one answer
warning_tz_not_equal_device_tz_is: Warning: Timezones are not equal.<br>         Device timezone (in settings):
usually_cloud_tz_and_device_tz_should_be: Usually the cloud timezone and the device timezone should be the same.
settings-cloudctrl-device-not-compatible: Your device is not compatible with the API. Update your device to the latest firmware.
whoIsYourInstallerPrivateQ1ProOption: A professional installer installed the device
whoIsYourInstallerPrivateQ3Label: Which electrician or installer installed your my-PV device?
